div.data-react-data-bundle: {"notifications":[{"id":7973,"message":"Washington's Governor Inslee has ordered traditional on-site public education to not continue through the end of the 2019-20 school year. Remote learning, to the best of our system's ability, will be provided through the end of the school year.","type":"banner"},{"id":7974,"message":"El gobernador de Washington Inslee a ordenado que la educaci\u00f3n p\u00fablica tradicional no contin\u00fae para el resto del a\u00f1o escolar 2019-2020. Proveeremos aprendizaje a distancia por el resto del a\u00f1o escolar a la mejor capacidad que nuestro sistema nos permite.","type":"banner"}]}

div.h3: How to Contact Eastmont District Office

div.p: Eastmont School District Office will be closed starting March 18th through April 24th or until further notice.
If you need to contact our office, please contact the email below according to your need:
div.div:
La oficina del distrito escolar de Eastmont estará cerrada empezando el dia 18 de Marzo hasta el dia 24 de Abril o hasta nuevo aviso.
Si necesita contactar a alguien de nuestra oficina, por favor diríjase a los correos electrónicos correspondientes a sus necesidades:

div.p: Special Education questions: [email protected] or [email protected]
Food Services questions: [email protected] or [email protected]
General Question or any other topic: [email protected]

a.title: Visit How to Contact Eastmont District Office Page

a.title: Anonymously Report Safety Concerns
a.div:
Anonymously report safety concerns, including bullying, harassment, and intimidation via phone, text, email, and district website.
• Students - have you seen or heard something that concerns you about a friend's safety? Another student's safety?
• Parents - are you concerned about your child or another student?
• Keeping our students safe from harm starts with letting someone know.
• Please use SafeSchools anytime, day or night, to share your concerns.

div.div:
The mission of the Eastmont School District is to maximize the potential of all students by providing:
Relationships - that support a safe and secure learning environment for students and staff.
Relevance - in education experiences that meet the needs of students, parents, and community.
Rigor - by having expectations that require students to develop and demonstrate academic excellence.
Results - that are used to improve and support student and employee success.

span.style: font-size: 21.3333px; font-family: Calibri; color: rgb(46, 117, 181); vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent;
font-size: 14.6667px; font-family: Tahoma; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent;

p.span: Eastmont School District does not discriminate in any programs or activities on the basis of sex, race, creed, religion, color, national origin, age, veteran or military status, sexual orientation, gender expression, gender identity, disability, or the use of a trained dog guide or service animal and provides equal access to the Boy Scouts and other designated youth groups. The following employee(s) have been designated to handle questions and complaints of alleged discrimination:

span.style: font-size: 14.6667px; font-family: Tahoma; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent;
font-size: 14.6667px; font-family: Tahoma; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent;
font-size: 17.3333px; font-family: Calibri; color: rgb(46, 117, 181); vertical-align: baseline; background-color: transparent;

p.span: Title IX is a comprehensive federal law that prohibits discrimination on the basis of sex in any federally funded education program or activity.

span.style: font-size: 14.6667px; color: rgb(91, 155, 213); text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline; background-color: transparent;
font-size: 14.6667px; font-family: Tahoma; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent;
font-size: 14.6667px; font-family: Tahoma; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent;
font-size: 17.3333px; font-family: Calibri; color: rgb(46, 117, 181); vertical-align: baseline; background-color: transparent;

p.span: Section 504 is a comprehensive federal law that prohibits discrimination, based on disabilities, in any federally funded education program or activity. It also ensures a free and public education to each qualified student with a disability who is in the school district’s jurisdiction, regardless of the nature or severity of the disability.
David Woods, Assistant Superintendent Secondary Education
Spencer Taylor, Executive Director of Elementary Education

span.style: text-decoration: underline; font-size: 14.6667px; font-family: Tahoma; color: rgb(91, 155, 213); background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

text-decoration: underline; font-size: 14.6667px; font-family: Tahoma; color: rgb(91, 155, 213); background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

text-decoration: none; font-size: 14.6667px; font-family: Tahoma; color: rgb(91, 155, 213); background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

text-decoration: none; font-size: 14.6667px; font-family: Tahoma; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;
font-size: 14.6667px; font-family: Tahoma; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent;
font-size: 14.6667px; font-family: Tahoma; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent;

p.span: Section 504 and Title II of the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) also prohibit employment discrimination.

span.style: font-size: 14.6667px; color: rgb(91, 155, 213); text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline; background-color: transparent;
font-size: 17.3333px; font-family: Calibri; color: rgb(46, 117, 181); vertical-align: baseline; background-color: transparent;

p.span: Federal civil rights laws prohibit discrimination based on sex, race, creed, religion, color, national origin, age, veteran or military status, sexual orientation, gender expression or identity, disability, or the use of a dog guide or trained service animal.
Civil Rights Compliance Coordinator, Vicki Trainor

span.style: font-size: 14.6667px; color: rgb(91, 155, 213); text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline; background-color: transparent;
font-size: 14.6667px; font-family: Tahoma; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent;
font-size: 21.3333px; font-family: Calibri; color: rgb(0, 112, 192); vertical-align: baseline; background-color: transparent;

p.span: El Distrito Escolar de Eastmont no discrimina en ningún programa o actividad basado en sexo, raza, credo, religión, color, origen nacional, edad, veterano o militar, orientación sexual, expresión o identidad de género, discapacidad, o el uso de un perro guía o animal de servicio entrenado y proporciona un acceso equitativo a los Boy Scouts y otros grupos juveniles designados. Los siguientes empleados han sido designados para encargarse de las preguntas y quejas de supuesta discriminación:

span.style: font-size: 17.3333px; font-family: Calibri; color: rgb(0, 112, 192); vertical-align: baseline; background-color: transparent;

p.span: Título IX es una ley federal integral que prohíbe la discriminación por razón de sexo en cualquier programa o actividad de educación con fondos federales.
Coordinadora del Título IX, Vicki Trainor

span.style: font-size: 14.6667px; color: rgb(5, 99, 193); text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline; background-color: transparent;
font-size: 14.6667px; font-family: Tahoma; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent;
font-size: 17.3333px; font-family: Calibri; color: rgb(0, 112, 192); vertical-align: baseline; background-color: transparent;

p.span: Sección 504 es una ley federal integral que prohíbe la discriminación, basado en discapacidad, en cualquier programa o actividad de educación con fondos federales. También garantiza una educación pública y gratuita a cada estudiante con una discapacidad que está en la jurisdicción del distrito escolar, sin importar la naturaleza o gravedad de la discapacidad.
David Woods, Director Ejecutivo de Educación Secundaria
Spencer Taylor, Director Ejecutivo de Educacion Primaria

span.style: font-size: 14.6667px; color: rgb(17, 85, 204); text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline; background-color: transparent;
font-size: 14.6667px; color: rgb(17, 85, 204); text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline; background-color: transparent;
font-size: 14.6667px; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); vertical-align: baseline; background-color: transparent;
font-size: 14.6667px; font-family: Tahoma; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent;

p.span: Sección 504 y Título II de la Ley de Americanos con Discapacidades (ADA) también prohíbe la discriminación en el empleo.

span.style: font-size: 14.6667px; color: rgb(5, 99, 193); text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline; background-color: transparent;
font-size: 14.6667px; font-family: Tahoma; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent;
font-size: 17.3333px; font-family: Calibri; color: rgb(0, 112, 192); vertical-align: baseline; background-color: transparent;

p.span: Las leyes federales de derechos civiles prohíben la discriminación por motivos de sexo, raza, credo, religión, color, origen nacional, edad, veterano o militar, orientación sexual, expresión o identidad de género, discapacidad, o el uso de un perro guía o animal de servicio entrenado.
Coordinadora de Cumplimiento de Derecho Civil, Vicki Trainor

span.style: font-size: 14.6667px; color: rgb(5, 99, 193); text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline; background-color: transparent;

a.title: Construction and Reconfiguration
a.div:
To best serve our students and accommodate growth in our community, we will be reconfiguring our school grade levels and adding classrooms to many of our schools.
Please click here for more information.

address.aria-label: Phone number for Eastmont School District
Fax number for Eastmont School District

span.data-emptytext: Eastmont School District provides equal opportunity in its programs, activities, and employment

p.a: Website Hosting Solution Powered by SchoolBlocks

div.h3:
Welcome to the SchoolBlocks
self-guided tour!
div.p: The most common question we receive is, how is SchoolBlocks inspired by Pinterest? SchoolBlocks eliminates navigation bars and uses a block style layout that’s similar to Pinterest. It creates a unique and engaging browsing experience, optimizes for mobile and removes a lot of navigational complexity.
Please click on the red plus signs found on this page to learn more about specific features.
As an administrator, you will have the custom page editing tools auto-load. Just click ‘read more’ to access our advanced page editing tools.
This bar holds all content types. Click on the Admin button, click "add block", select a content type, add your content then insert the block into the page.
This icon appears when you have edit permissions. Hold your mouse down and move the block. You’ll see the page reorganize!
Each block type has a custom editing experience. Click the pencil on any block or view our help documentation to learn more about block types.
